p: Dispersal is an important factor in insect invasions and plays an important role in determining their potential distribution including that of B. zonata [ 22â€“ 24]. Bactrocera zonata has the capability of dispersing locally reaching distances of up to 25 miles (40.2 km) [ 7, 8]. Our model uses the known occurrence records of B. zonata as basis to develop several Gaussian functions centred on each location. Each Gaussian function has a height of 1, a mean of 0 and value (density of fruit fly) decreasing with distance in relation to the width or standard deviation.
